page.title: 17Employment-Bury St. Edmunds
page.content: The main industry in the area is closely linked to the predominant activity which is arable farming. The largest employer is a producer of agricultural machinery which also provides services to local farmers for maintenance of their machinery. The firm is owned by a German parent company and there are strong links with European markets made possible by the direct link of the A45 dual-carriage way which gives easy access to the growing east coast ports. Nearer to the town there is a number of industrial estates which are designed to encourage light industry to the area. These range from light engineering to sweet manufacture and were part of the 'London Overspill' scheme to draw population away from the capital to developing areas.
